text.p: Database software company Oracle Corp on Tuesday unveiled a line of products, including its updated database product, low-cost server software and an all-in-one network computer product.
The company, the leader in the $5.7 billion database software business, introduced Oracle 8, a new version of its database product that can handle much more information while costing less to manage.
Oracle's Network Computer Inc subsidiary unveiled its NC Server software, which delivers a low-cost method for deploying network computers.

Network Computers are low-cost, scaled-down computers that access the internet and other networks. NC Server software provides all of the software needed to quickly and set up and support a network of NCs.

Oracle also unveiled its "Network-In-a-Box" program, a network computer system. It consists of NCI's software and NCI hardware partners' products, and will be available in July for $4,995, the company said.
